revised_title: Ernst Julius Cohen: A Pioneering Chemist and Disciple of van't Hoff
tldr: Ernst Julius Cohen was a renowned Dutch chemist and a prominent disciple of van't Hoff. He conducted extensive research on polymorphism, electrochemistry, thermochemistry, and piezochemistry. Cohen's work on standard galvanic cells and electrochemical thermodynamics contributed significantly to the field of physical chemistry. Tragically, he was murdered during the Holocaust in 1944.
